{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents describe HIV as a retrovirus that infects host cells for life. It replicates slowly but can explosively up-regulate upon stimulation. The virus is known to replicate in an error-prone way, constantly changing its structure. In the relevant document '[Isolation of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) in epidemic area of HIV infection in Yunnan Province]', it is mentioned that the viruses isolated from infected persons infect only PMCs and grow slowly with gradual increase of RT activity. This suggests that the virus replicates slowly, which is consistent with its error-prone replication mechanism.", "answer_choice": "C"}
